dimidiatus C. Sahlberg, 1830: 326
(
Staphylinus
; [ Note: Preoccupied ; this name was a secondary homonym of
Paederus dimidiatus Panzer, 1795
, when both names were

in
Philonthus
. Tottenham (1939d: 233) recognized that fact and cited
P . caucasicus
,

a junior synonym of
P . dimidiatus
, as the valid name of the species. Furthermore, the Sahlberg name evidently is a junior primary homonym of
Staphylinus dimidiatus Say, 1830
, which may have been published August 20, 1830 (Bousquet, 1993), whereas the month of publication for the Sahlberg name is December as no month has been specified for the work]; Type locality: Willnäs).
